questions.text: What did Norm and Cliff like to count while watching movies?
questions.explanation:
anachronisms.

	An anachronism is something that is after the time period for which the story takes place. For example, having a character wearing Nike shoes in a show that takes place in the 1600s would be an anachronism.  At the beginning of the show, Cliff and Norm were arguing over who found the most anachronisms.

questions.text: Who was going to be on TV?
questions.explanation:
Frasier.

	Frasier was going to be doing a psychology show. The gang didn't want to watch the show because they thought it would be boring.

questions.text: Who did the man debate with on the TV show?
questions.explanation:
Lilith.

	All 4 of these people were a part of Frasier's life. He dated and almost married Diane, Bennett Ludlow was his mentor, and Sigmund Freud was the founder of psychoanalysis which is what Frasier practiced. However, it was Lilith that he debated causing embarrassment to both he and her.

questions.text: What did Diane say is the opposite of love?
questions.explanation:
indifference.

	Sam didn't buy what she had to say. When he told Frasier he also disagreed.

questions.text: Who did Diane think is in love with Dr. Sternin?
questions.explanation:
Frasier.

	Frasier and Lilith were flirting big time on the TV show. They fought like crazy, so Sam believed they hated each other. Diane however believed they were in love and that's why they fought like they did.

Woody, Cliff and Norm.

	Woody wanted to go on a fishing trip but the two men kept coming up with reasons why they couldn't go. Woody finally prepares for each excuse they might have, so they end up going.

Cliff.

	Cliff caught a tiny fish. However, to hear him talk one would think he caught the world's biggest fish.

questions.text: Why couldn't Lilith thank Diane for her "Pygmalion like efforts"?
options: copyright laws forbid her to mention Pygmalion
questions.explanation:
they led to disaster.

	"Pygmalion" was a play written by George Bernard Shaw (named for a Greek mythological character). In it, Henry Higgins transforms Eliza Doolittle from a low class, non-educated woman into a woman who could meet with the highest of society and fit right in. Diane took Lilith, a woman who wore no make-up and kept her hair in a bun, very plain looking, and made her into a beautiful woman. Frasier reacted to this change on the television program causing them both to be embarrassed by their actions.

questions.text: How many patients did Frasier say he lost?
questions.explanation:
3.

	Lilith said she picked up 3 new patients when Frasier said he lost 3. He lost his patients as a result of his actions on the tv show he was on.

Yes.

	At the end Lilith lets her hair down again, and Frasier comments on how he's gonna kiss her. Then Lilith kisses him and he said "Yes like that." This is the episode in which they start dating and Bebe Neuwirth becomes a regular guest star. She is only an actual member of the cast during the tenth season.
